channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023120703
item.description:
Report X-2023120703

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ALL FOUR OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023121165
item.description:
Report X-2023121165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-17
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL IN NOTED THAT ONE 2 LITER BOTTLE WAS CRACKED AND LEAKING. THE LEAKING BOTTLE LEAKED ONTO THE OTHER THREE BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP

item.title: Report X-2024010017
item.description:
Report X-2024010017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX WAS BEING AUDITED IN THE DMP. IT WAS WET ON THE SIDE. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX AND FOUND THAT IT WAS LEAKING FROM THE CAPS. TAKEN BY THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO BE PROPERLY DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023120672
item.description:
Report X-2023120672

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found to be leaking in the unload. QA was called and the package was placed in a plastic lined tote and brought to QA for examination. DescribePack: Package contains flammable liquid and has appropriate markings but no hazmat service or op-900. The inner packages are we and dented indication rough handling/improper loading leading to leakage through the caps. DurationRel: 11 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined tote and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023120867
item.description:
Report X-2023120867

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: COLBY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unloading trailer, discovered 3 containers with one being nearly empty while others were full. Upon inspection, found puncture on bottom of container. Placed container in HAZMAT bin and safety removed from trailer after verifying that no additional clean up was needed / exposure was not a factor. DescribePack: Small puncture on bottom of container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat tote and removed from trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023120778
item.description:
Report X-2023120778

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LOADER NOTICED A LARGE AMOUNT OF PAINT COMING OUT OF BOX ON THE BELT. CALLED RESPONDER. THERE WERE TWO INNER BOXES CONTAINING 12 AEROSOLS EACH. THERE WAS A SMALL AMOUNT OF KRAFT PAPER TO CUSHION INNER BOXES BUT FAR MORE SPACE AND BOTH INNER BOXES MOVED AROUND FREELY. THE LIDS OF MOST OF THE CANS WERE CRACKED AND ALL WERE SOILED.

item.title: Report X-2023121101
item.description:
Report X-2023121101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING GUIDLINES. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER AND ALL CONTAIMENATED BOXES FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023120596
item.description:
Report X-2023120596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE AT THE TENDER POSITION WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKING PACKAGE PACKING ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THAT ONE CAR BATTERY WAS CRACK ON THE SIDE. THE BATTERY WAS IN A BAG WITH EXPANSION FOAM AROUND IT. THE BATTERY WAS DISPOSED OF THROUGH OUTSIDE VENDOR AND THE CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.

item.title: Report E-2023120450
item.description:
Report E-2023120450

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ERTS was notified of a 2 cup release of UN1760, ELAN-Tron® C 2006 Hardener from a 55 gallon drum due to a forklift accident. The release was contained to the dock floor. No Drains, Soils or water way were impacted.
